Class Highscores

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • Highscores
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.awt.print.Printable, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class Highscores
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.print.Printable
    This class displays the Happy Hedgehog Co. logo on an aesthetically pleasing background, and more importantly displays the top high scores saved in a seperate file for each level of the game. This class also has methods that display to the user if their score is high scores worthy. Note that since javadoc is not picking up caught exceptions, we included the exceptions in the local variables.

    Verison 1 (2.5 Hours): The methods created were purely for printing the highscores (the getHighscores(), displayHighscores() amd print methods)

    Verison 2 (4 Hour): The setHighscores() method was implemented, which also displays level complete.

    Version:
    1 05.16.16, 2 05.23.16 Program name: Highscores.java
    Author:
    Aashmika Mali
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Highscores

        public Highscores()
        This is the no parameter class constructor. It calls the class MouseAdapter, to with abstract method MousePressed to check what button the user selected. The if structure checks where the user has pressed, and then carries out the correct operations. The inside if structure checks if the object can be printed. This constructor makes it possible for the user to use keyboard shortcuts.

        Local variables:

        relativeX This creates an int variable to save the x location of where the user clicked.

        relativeY This creates an int variable to save the y location of where the user clicked.

        ok This boolean saves the value of if the object is good for printing.

        job Of type PrinterJob, it saves the job needed to print the object.

        back This points to the Action class.

        print This points to the Action class.

        Parameters:

        e - This points to the ActionEvent class.

    • Method Detail

      • doPrintStuff

        public void doPrintStuff()
        This method makes sure it is okay to print and then it calls the print method.

        ok This boolean saves the value of if the object is good for printing.

        job Of type PrinterJob, it saves the job needed to print the object.

        Exceptions:

        PrinterException ex It is the caught exception when calling the print method.

      • getInformation

        public static void getInformation()
        This method gets the information in the .aash files for the cores, and saves them in the instance arraylists. The try and catch block tries to read from the files, and catch for any IOexcptions. The if structures check if the header matches in the .aash files. The for loops are used to keep reading in information for the number of scores.

        Local variables:

        input, input2, input3 This creates a BufferedReader for each .aash file the user is reading to.

        d This is the for loop int variable incremented for the number of scores in the file.

        Exceptions:

        IOException o This is the exception caught when reading from another file.

      • paintComponent

        public void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
        This method displays the scores and background for the user to see before printing. The if structures check if there are any scores to print. The for loops repeat for the number of scores in the level. The try and catch block try to read the Image file successfully, and catches for the IOException. This method overrides the super paintComponent method.

        Local variables:

        a This is the for loop variable incremented for the number of scores for the level.

        Exceptions:

        IOException e This is the exception caught when reading an image from a file.

        Overrides:
        paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics is needed to display the images.

      • insertion

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> insertion(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> array)
        This method sorts the scores and their correspoding names into the proper largest to smallest order, using the insertion sorting technique. The for loop is used to sort for all elements of the arrayList. The while loop is to sort if the temp was greater than another integer. The if structure in the algorithm is to check if the score is greater than the temp score. The other if structure is used to save the correct name in the correct name arraylist.

        Local variables:

        stringTempThis saves the temporary name while sorting.

        i This is the for loop variable incremented for the number of elements in the score array.

        j This is an integer used to check every element of the array.

        temp This saves the temporary score while sorting.

        Parameters:
        array - ArrayList Integer passes in the score array.
        Returns:
        array ArrayList Integer returns the scores

      • setHighscores

        public static void setHighscores(int score,
                                 java.lang.String name)
        This method sets a highscore to the file based on the scores entered throgh the parameter. It is a static method, so the score can be set from another class. The try and catch is used to make sure that it catches for an error when writing to another file. The if structures are used to check what arraylist to save the score and name to, and also to check if there are already 10 scores, otherwise the numScores is incremented. The for loops are used to write all the scores and names to the files.

        Local variables:

        file This creates a PrintWriter to allow the program to write to another file.

        nameOfFile A string that saves the file name.

        Exceptions:

        IOException e It is an exception caught when writing to a file.

        Parameters:
        score - int passes in the score to set.
        name - String passes in the name to set.

      • print

        public int print(java.awt.Graphics g,
                 java.awt.print.PageFormat pf,
                 int page)
          throws java.awt.print.PrinterException
        This method is an abstract method of printable, used to print to the printer. The if structure check if there are scores to print, otherwise the string is not drawn to the printer graphics. The for loops draw all the names and scores for the levels for the amount of times needed.
        Specified by:
        print in interface java.awt.print.Printable
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics is used for the graphics the print method is drawing to.
        pf - PageFormat is used for the method's
        Returns:
        int
        Throws:
        java.awt.print.PrinterException - needed for this print method.
